reviews.text:
Front desk help was not very welcoming. Never offered us water or a snack as diamond members. Seemed annoyed when I asked for it. That’s not how you treat your frequent clients.
Four tiny little pillows for a king sized bed.
Overall room was nice. Showing some age though.
Parking is very limited.

I booked the Suite, which was GREAT, plenty of room, quiet...definitely worth it.

I was warmly greeted upon arrival from front desk staff. Though I showed up several hours before the 3pm Check-In, staff offered to hold my luggage, which made it easier to do some sightseeing & have lunch without carrying baggage around.

As soon as I checked in, I got a pleasant text, thanking me for staying here and asking if I need anything else, which was very reassuring.

I requested extra towels, as I used the pool facilities, which they promptly brought me.

I appreciated the staff maintaining the complimentary beverage station in lobby, as it was highly used.

Overall, this was GREAT experience staying here, the staff (ALL of them that I interacted with) gave me pleasant, attentive, hospitalible service, THAT sincerity really stood out! Thanks Hampton Inn and Suites! 🙂

Overall good place to stay for business travelers. Property I well maintained and rooms are spacious and clean. Very comfortable in the rooms.
The staff is very cooperative and helpful and make you feel comfortable on arrival.
I would highly recommend stay here.

Had a very good experience with all personnel.  Nikki at the desk was very helpful!   and gave good suggestions.  Great location to start the Gap bike trail and easy walk to restaurants!  Easy access to the park to start the Gap and parking is safe  and  free if you reserve a return stay.  Big enough rooms to store your bikes!  Good breakfast!  All around great place to stay!

Every time we visit Pittsburgh we stay at the Hampton Inn on Smallman. The free parking is such a bonus...who wants to pay as much as $30 a day just to park your car?  Free coffee in the downstairs lobby.

The front desk staff are so friendly and helpful (a big thank you to  Abby and Holly!!).

The room is open and spacious with a sofa, microwave, fridge and TV. We always get a king size bed....very comfortable. The bathroom has a massive shower. A hairdryer is provided as are all the toiletries you need. My husband says it is pretty much perfect!

The complimentary breakfast is really good...fruit, waffles, bacon, omelettes,  juices - all the good stuff you would expect.

The location is fantastic. You can walk anywhere downtown very easily. We love the strip district which is a couple of hundred yards away with its great food stops.  Also, a must visit is a monthly vintage market during season. A lovely walking path along the river front is about 100 yards away that takes you all the way to  Point State Park where the rivers meet.

You can easily walk across the river to the football and baseball stadiums and to the Andy Warhol museum. The Heinz History museum is directly across the street from the hotel.

If you want to bring your dogs or cats this is the place for you!  For a flat fee of $75 per stay you can bring 2 cats or dogs.

Make your reservation soon. You will not be disappointed.

Love this place! Brittany, the GM, and her staff are magnificent.  We had an issue or two and the staff fixed them right away.  Brittany went above and beyond to make it right and to make our stay worth it. We like staying here when we come to town for Penguins games. Parking is so convenient. PPG Paints Arena is just a few feet from the Cambria.  Hotel bar is nice. Lobby and hallways are clean.  The bathroom could have used a little cleaning, but overall pretty good. The new mattress was very comfy!  Swimming pool is nice and appeared clean. And finally, it was quiet at night! If there were people above, below or next to us, we couldn't hear them.  Can't wait to go back!

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary (a few years back), and it was wonderful! The staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable and we Appreciated that. I also came here for my work Christmas party and the service was stellar.
The location isn't the best however, their parking lot makes up for having to brave the downtown traffic. I'll definitely come back here.

GUESTS BEWARE!! The hotel itself is nice but they fraudulently charged my credit card $300 after I checked out. After disputing it with my bank the hotel is still refusing to reverse the charge and it has been a nightmare. Very unfortunate situation but we will certainly never be back. Unless you are prepared to be charged fraudulently and spend hours filing complaints getting your money back - book anywhere else!!! Stayed in December and in February the charge is still on my card.

Edited to add: after reading these other reviews, it's nice to know I'm not alone. The illegal overcharging is an ongoing issue and someone needs to be help accountable!

This place was great!  The staff was friendly and helpful, the room and hotel were very clean; the room was spacious and comfortable and feels like a suite the way it is laid out.  Just a very nice place that is a great value!

I drove from Ohio for a concert that I learned was canceled upon arriving at the hotel. I booked this room due to great experiences with Cambria in Ohio and it is right beside the Arena. Since the concert was canceled they did allow me to cancel my room. However, the problem I'm having is that you have to get a ticket upon arrival for parking. When I exited the parking area it had me scan the ticket to get out and it wanted me to pay $50.00. I couldn't back up because there were multiple cars behind me due to others leaving I'm assuming due to the canceled concert. I called into the hotel to see if they could do something and was put on hold. So I went ahead and paid the $50.00 so that I could exit and not keep others waiting. The next morning I tried calling into the hotel and couldn't reach anyone. I have sent two detailed emails with attachments that have gone unanswered. I even reached out to Choice Hotels and received a very nice response that they each location is individually owned but that they tried reaching out to this location on my behalf and was unable to reach anyone as well. So it looks like I paid $50.00 to park my car, go inside and learn the concert was canceled, go back out to my car and leave.

Hotel room was lovely. Rain shower head with wand that has excellent water pressure.  Housekeeping staff are sweet and very accommodating. Laundry service for a fee. Pick up a form and a bag at the front desk, fill out and drop off your clothes before 9am and get them back that evening. Gorgeous views with several coffee shops around, and close to food and shopping.

I recently stayed at the Westin Pittsburgh, and I must say, the customer service was exceptional! From the moment I arrived, the staff greeted me with warm smiles and genuine hospitality. They went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable, providing personalized recommendations and quick responses to any requests. The attention to detail and commitment to guest satisfaction truly set this hotel apart. I highly recommend the Westin Pittsburgh for a delightful experience!

The rooms are okay , pretty standard US room type. The hotel gym is great , lots of equipment and space. The breakfast is overpriced for what it is, but you do have coffee outlets nearby or breakfast spots within walking distance. Room service isn’t 24hrs, only am or pm food offerings. The hotel is downtown so depending what you coming to the city for , but over the weekend it’s pretty dead around the area. The strip district is about a 20min walk from the hotel for a quirky area.

Worst Marriott property ever!!! No offer of housekeeping or $5 daily credit to deny housekeeping then find hangar in room for such and have to go back to front desk and wait I. Line for vouchers. When asked for vouchers due to refusal to upgrade titanium status, nothing was done. Robe in room has brown stains all over it, long black hair laying around and a reminiscent homely brown stains smell graces the pathetic small room without common amenities at much “lower class” hotels. This place should be downgraded and investigated for criminal offenses regarding price gouging and false representation/marketing. Never have I experienced such a lack of quality property for Marriott brands. Rethinking Marriott loyalty due to this.

Hotel was great. Very convenient area and many amenities. Upon check-in, Bridget was so very helpful. She made the check-in seamless. She gave great information about local attractions and different restaurants. Will definitely stay here again

Want a hot shower? This isn’t the place for you. Multiple people in my group had the same experience. No hot water for the last 2 days.

The rooms are old, dirty and dated. It’s a shame. This seems like should be a nice Marriott property.

So overall the experience was fine. The hotel is located downtown close to the cultural center and restaurants. However, during my stay the hotel unauthorized an additional payment a day after I checked in. When I informed the staff that my card was charged an additional $700 I was informed "oh sorry that was the computer night audit.  That happens when guests' card are charged extra because their card is on file". SMH WHAT?! That was the only reason for the charge, no parking costs, no room services, no incidentals (we still had 4 more days of our stay). There was no reason for the extra charge provided outside "our computer did it".  This offset the balance in my baking account and I reported the charge as fraud to my bank and turned off my card.
I'm curious to know how often Marriott does this to their guests,  especially since the staff seemed to be used to this happening?! Presents as untrustworthy

Rooms are a bit dated Services fabulous you cannot beat the location. Crystal in the bar after a hockey game is like a machine! You have to see it to believe it! Tipper heavy and often! Thank you Crystal for all you do!

As a lifetime Titanium Rewards Member with 1500+ Marriott Night Stays, this property was in the worst and most dated physical condition of any full service Marriott in which I have stayed. The rooms didn't have any USB ports, and only some had renovated bathrooms. (One of the rooms they offered me did not. Fortunately, mind did.) Even though I was on 18th floor, you could hear some road noise. The windows need to be serviced or replaced, among many other things.
The Concierge Lounge was very small for this size property, and cleared out of any staff or desserts at 940pm when I arrived. Both are supposed to be there until 10pm.
The valet parking is way overpriced ($40), and provides limited service - they are only there from 7am-10pm, so they are of limited use. At that price, they should be available 24/7 like at other hotels, and perhaps even wash the car for you. So you don't really need them .
You also have to pay the parking vendor the $40 up front. It is unaffiliated with the hotel and cannot be billed on your room folio. Ridiculous.
They did not have my guaranteed room type (king), and while I was solo, so it wasn't a huge deal, it could have been less than ideal.
My Marriott status was not acknowledged and certainly not appreciated with the proper room type at check-in.
Also, I was in 1817 and the guy in 1818 was on speaker phone and I could hear everything quite loudly, both from my room and the corridor.
On a positive note, the location was excellent for me because I was going to PPG Paints Arena.
Rachel and her male colleague on the evening shift, and the night auditor, were super nice. (Not quite the case with the woman who checked me in.)
THIS HOTEL NEEDS A TOTAL RENOVATION ASAP!!!

Good location and friendly staff. Parking is a big issue if you have a car (30$ in a parking lot or 40$ for the valet). Security could be improved especially through the garage and elevator access.

Room is big and clean. Hotel is quite. Had problem with the AC for 2 days, but the hotel changed my room eventually. Also in the second room i faced the same issue with the AC. I kept calling guest service who called the maintenance guy to repair the AC. To be fair the response time was fast. But never the less, guest should not face such issue.

Breakfast is a menu order. Buffet in the week end only.

Price is bit high. I recommend you download the marriott app for better deals.

Overall, fair experience

Location is good but that is all the positive things I can write. It costs $40 to valet your car - ridiculous. Just slightly increase the price of the room so it's not a hidden fee. In the room, my alarm was set to ring at 6:00am and I couldn't fall back to sleep afterwards. When I tried to shower, the handle was loose so each time I tried to adjust the temperature, the handle would fall down due to gravity. I had to choose between a cold shower or a scolding hot one. It was awful. THEN, when I checked out and tried to explain to the girl who was working (December 21 at 12:09pm), she was rude. She never once looked up from her computer, didn't make eye contact once, didn't thank me for staying, etc. When I was telling her about the alarm, she never looked up from her computer, didn't apologize for the inconvenience - nothing. I felt like I was bothering her. When I tried to explain the shower and she refused to look at me, I said that you're not even looking at me and her response was 'I can hear you'. I said never mind and walked off. She should NOT be working with the public if she couldn't care less about her job. An apology is the least the hotel could do. According to other reviews, rudeness from staff has been reported and the owner explained that it was a 'teachable moment' and it was an 'isolated incident'. Couldn't be further from the truth.
Great location for the Convention Center.  Room was nice but dated a bit in the bathroom.  Elevators were busy so plan on waiting on that a few minutes.  All in all a nice place.

Christina is the reason for my 5 star review! The location and room were great but Christina at the front desk provided me with excellent and friendly customer service which I deeply appreciate. She made my experience here great!

Nice rooms and a great location. Only complaint is they start trying to clean your room the morning of checkout whether or not you have actually checked out. 3 times our door opened while we were getting around for the day.
Great hotel. Stayed for a conference. Super well located in downtown. Some of the friendliest hotel staff. Very good rooms. Highly recommended.
Have not received a signal in over a year and live only 2 miles from Pittsburgh PA.
Why is there no transmission of your programs tonight January 19th there is so much interference
Radio tower wqed Oakland Pittsburgh
Sux to climb
Tall

name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel & Suites Pittsburgh Downtown
address: One Bigelow Sq, Pittsburgh, PA 15219, USA

reviews.text:
This location is the perfect spot if you're visiting out of town. We walked almost everywhere we needed to be, didn't need a rental car. They have a restaurant in the hotel that serves breakfast and an attached 7/11 which was really nice. They have a 24 hour gym, swimming pool and valet.

The room was good for what we needed it for. I would absolutely stay here again. Great staff, very friendly and good customer service

Stayed here on multiple occasions. Crystal at the front desk is absolutely wonderful. After a long day of traveling, she was very patient as I fumbled for my ID and answered all my questions. I also noticed she was incredibly helpful with the guest in line before me as well. Top notch service Crystal, thank you!

All of the staff from the front desk to the valet were incredibly friendly and welcoming……which is why I believed them when they told me the $15 diamond member credit applied to the snack market.  If you are told this*****Do not believe them**** You will be charged and the manager will  side with his staff and not give you the courtesy of believing you.  I travel all of the time and never use this credit unless I am told I can use it at the snack market.  Bad customer service.
As others have mentioned the rooms could use an update as they are pretty run down but they are by no means unlivable.
The location is fantastic for PPG arena and walking pretty much anywhere downtown
3 stars for customer service and the need to start updating the rooms

Great hotel! It’s in need of a little TLC in a few different areas, but overall I enjoy every stay I have here. The staff is friendly, and is willing to go out of their way to make my stay better (giving room upgrades due to status). I also highly recommend the restaurant here as well. I will be returning. Thanks Crystal and Alley!

DO NOT RECOMMEND!! Car got broken into!!! When you arrive, you have to valet park.  After parking, we went out to our vehicle to find all compartment lids open and things strewn out of them, as well as, glovebox wide open.  Items stolen.  Explanation we were told by the valet staff manager, is that the new lock boxes they use to store the car keys in are so close to the door handles that if someone tries to open the doors it will automatically unlock.   The box hangs on the car window. Huge security issue, right?!?!!!   So why are they still using if the area is not surveil-lanced and  making sure the one entrance garage is monitored?!????!  When this was brought to their attention, the valet manager, showed us a sign that read, not responsible for lost or damaged items, etc. This place is a joke!!!  The room is much to be desired. From cosmetic appeal to needing fresh coat of paint. Toilet ran water all the time, shower dripped water.  Close and convenient to the Lawrence Convention Center, but not the best area.  Would not recommend to anyone!!!!

name: Hilton Garden Inn Pittsburgh University Place

reviews.text: Great location. Lots of take out nearby. Easy parking nearby ($6) or in hotel garage ($35 plus fees = $45). Rooms are clean enough. A bit tired looking. Had to call Hilton 3 times to make sure we had connecting rooms. :-/

Surge pricing resulted in a $500/night room that looks exactly the same as the video review from 5 years ago. I tried to modify the reservation one and two days before arrival by calling multiple separate times and the front desk phone was never picked up. The sink spewed up black gunk for no apparent reason - disgusting. Our room was on the 3rd floor - avoid this!! Both Saturday and Sunday mornings from about 7-10a there was a near continuous extremely loud banging from below - some sort of mechanical or loading dock sound maybe?
Valet cost should be included in this expensive of a rate.
Excellent location for Pitt visit and access to restaurants.
No where near worth $500/night.
I have stayed at 5 different hotels in this area and will not return to this one. Very disappointing for a Hilton property.

The rooms at this Hilton location looked outdated, as if they were from the 1930s. The first room we were given had a non-functional HVAC system, which forced us to walk all the way back to the front desk to request a different room. To make matters worse, there was no additional staff available after 11 PM—only the front desk person was on duty.

On top of everything, guests are required to pay an additional $35 for valet parking, which felt excessive given the overall experience.

This stay was incredibly disappointing, and I will not be choosing Hilton for my business trips in the future.

Decent hotel close to University. A little old but worth the money. My main complaint is the table/chair is put right next to AC and the AC is way too loud to sit next to. And it's actually rough for me to sleep with AC on because of the noise.

No carts available upon check in to get our luggage to the room.
$30/night for parking.
Room smaller than other Hiltons I have stayed at.
This is minor but toilet close to the floor-would be an issue for someone taller.
Went to the restaurant for dinner and even though half empty, had to wait in the hallway for tables to be cleaned.  1 menu not available and 1 item on the correct menu sold out.  Salmon was a very small piece but waitress warned us.  Mashed potatoes not hot.  Restaurant understaffed but waitress nice.
Sirens outside our room window multiple times.
Location good for where I needed to be.

Very unique place to go! They have a great selection of beer (even though I don't drink beer). The food was good. We honestly came here because it was a unique place to eat. The incorporation of the brewery within the church was a creative idea.

Beautiful building! Loved that they resurrected St John’s and conserved the historic building. Such a cool idea. Gave food 4 stars only because we had beer and a pretzel- no actual meal. Service was a bit slower than we would have liked but they were really busy when we were there. Would definitely go back for dinner some time.

Our waiter was amazing, we had 3 kids with us and he was so kind, quick and caring. The food was amazing I got the Mac and cheese with the brussel sprouts. Probably the best food I’ve had in a while, so much flavor.  Atmosphere is very fun and large area. Not crowded but we went around noon on a Friday. I would highly recommend this place. Parking is in the back.

Cool space...definitely something different. A church converted into a brewery is very unique...to say the least. They even kept the stain-glass windows!

Lots of space inside...tables and bar seating. It was very empty around 5pm on a Sunday. The staff said they usually get much busier when the local teams are playing.

Great selection of beer and some interesting food options. I was only there briefly for a beer ($7ish) and some meatballs ($13ish) but they were both good.

The hostess and the bartender were very nice.

I would love to return to try some other things.

Prices were reasonable. I believe there are also some happy hours specials so you may want to check those out.

Lots of street parking on the main road in front.

Very cool use of an old church, loved the vibe! Menu was very eclectic (no real theme of any kind). There were nine of us, service was good and pretty quick-they were heading into dinner rush on a Friday night. The portions were about right. However, none of us were overly impressed with anything we got. It was all okay, nothing bad, just nothing I'd go out of my way for. Great vibe though, I'd probably go back and get apps and a beer.

Stumbled upon this place while walking at the strip district. Checked on Google and they seem pretty popular, hence decided to try.

The place was a nice cosy bar place that’s family and couple friendly. They were packed but was quick to find me a spot to sit as I was dining alone.

Had the pastrami and cheese Primati. Bread, ingredients are all fresh which is a huge plus. However, something was a little missing for me. Something that brings all the ingredients together as one.

If am back in Pittsburgh in future, would pop in and try something different.

Restroom is downstairs with a steep flight of stairs. Wouldn’t recommend anyone who’s drink to embark on that journey down…

It was a decent meal , but the service and those who tended to making the food, prepping it, and ringing each customer out where excellent! They were great and attentive to everyone's needs! Not just my party, but others around us!

I had my wife wait in line while I tried to find parking. She was next in line by the time I parked and walked back. We had a corned beef and a couple of beers. The sandwich was great, the bread was fresh and soft, and the meat was excellent. I would definitely go back again.
Was delicious and not too heavy . The pastrami sandwich by far the best ! Friendly service , great slaw and fries. Fluffy light bread . Taste of Pittsburgh

Bread was amazing and so fresh. Would not recommend pittsburger. Fries were awful but service was quick and little to no line to get in. Don’t attempt to go down stairs while drunk or at least be careful when going to the bathroom.

Nice hotel—everything was clean well maintained. Rooms had quality construction (like solid wood doors and carefully tiled bathrooms) and high ceilings. Breakfast is made to order and bagged for you to pick up in the dining room. Relaxing environment and very close (across the courtyard) to the Grand Hall event venue. Pictures and signs showing the history of the building were scattered throughout. Nice mix of preserving history with modern convenience, quality and amenities. Had a great experience!

Attended an office holiday party here, but didn't stay at the hotel. The meeting space was excellent. It strangely felt spacious and cozy simultaneously. The food and drink were good too. The wait staff were excellent, so everything ran very smoothly.

I never write reviews but I feel this hotel does not live up to its rating.  I suspect they are curating other negative reviews,

First, we arrived after dark and the neighborhood is not the best.  I could overlook this but I was in town for work and brought my wife along—now I have to worry about her safety if she ventures out on foot. Not that there is much in the vicinity… the walk downtown involves going  under several highway overpasses, sort of a concrete tunnel feel that even makes me a bit nervous.

The front desk clerk was not very friendly.  He checked us in quickly but it wasn't very welcoming…not a big deal to me except all the online reviews tall up the great staff and how warm and welcoming everyone is—-definitely did not get that vibe.

The room itself was on the small side.  The bathroom was quite small by modern standards and the shower is downright claustrophobic.  The room was hot and despite adjusting the hvac controls we could not get the room temperature to change.  On the plus side things seemed clean.  The mattress clearly had some age to it but it wasn't horrible.

Overall I feel hoodwinked by the positive reviews on this place.  It's a 3 at best so please beware and act accordingly.

Quaint and cozy hotel in an old priory attached to a church. The breakfast courtyard is absolutely gorgeous. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The staff were incredibly helpful, the free parking very convenient and close by. One star removed for the incidentals fee of $50 that gets actively charged every night versus held and released like every other hotel. I now have an additional $150 USD on my card that I have to hope and trust will be refunded in the next two weeks. Also the breakfast has zero protein options unless you like croissant breakfast sandwiches and I would call it more of a snack, not to be relied on to fuel your morning. Otherwise the stay was great and we would stay again.

This was my first time in Pittsburgh and I absolutely loved staying at The Priory! Not only did they have amazing service and one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed at but their breakfast was held in a sister named Cafe that shares the same name as my restaurant in Columbus Ohio "The Refectory" breakfast was quick and easy with having it all ready to go when I needed to leave at 9am for my event at had going on! I'll be returning for another stay!

Waited a while for a table but that’s to be expected because literally everyone and their mother was lined up for a table. The wait was so worth it!
service = friendly and efficient.
sunny side up eggs = cooked perfectly
Bacon = scrumptious
Corned beef hash = incredible.
Now, those pancakes……  they’re the best I’ve ever had…. Not to mention the banana & chocolate chips. 🙂‍↔️

Got there early and was quickly served with a cup of coffee and my order taken. Went for the Pittsburg Hash which was exactly the hearty breakfast I needed! I say I could’ve eaten two but to be honest I was full after one. Attentive staff ensured my mug was never empty and topped up my flask for the cold walk back to my hotel. Excellent place; I will difinitely be back!

If your in Pittsburgh this is a must stop for breakfast.  Food was fantastic, the Pittsburgh hash was some of the best I have ever had. The service was excellent, easy to tell she had been there quite awhile, got us every thing we needed.  Atmosphere was so cool, very retro feeling with some very interesting artifacts. We ordered the french toast with carmel and pecans for the table and it was incredible, desert for breakfast.  I highly recommend Pamela’s for some great eats if in Pittsburgh.

Dear Pamela’s
Thanks for a great breakfast. I loved my two eggs and my wife loved her omelette. We love the potatoes and everything was cooked perfectly. The service was extra friendly and fast. We can’t wait to come back. See you next time. Cheers.

When we arrived around 11:30 am on a Sunday, the wait for a party of 2 was 10 minutes, which was quite reasonable for such a popular diner. The crepe-style hotcakes were delicious and filling, and the diner vibes were great. I highly recommend this spot for breakfast!

Living at Oak Hill Apartments for three years has been absolutely fantastic. The sense of community here is incredible; everyone is like a big family and always ready to help in every aspect. The staff has been so helpful and quick to resolve any issues, making my stay comfortable and stress-free. The amenities, such as the pool and fitness center, are fantastic and well-maintained. Additionally, the location is super convenient, with everything I need nearby. For instance, there's a store right in the middle of the complex that stocks everything you might need, and they even have a takeout food place that I tried, and it was delicious. I can't recommend Oak Hill Apartments enough – it has been an amazing place to call home for three years, and I'm truly grateful for the experience. Thank you to everyone at Oak Hill Apartments for making it all so special! 👍🏻

I have been living in Oak Hill for the past few years, and my experience has been disappointing. For example, I had an issue with my doorbell that took 4-5 months to fix, despite notifying the maintenance team. Additionally, I requested a second set of keys several months ago, followed up with reminders, but no one ever got back to me. Drunk individuals often make noise until 3-4 a.m. especially in summer and there is no security presence to address the disturbances. It seems the only focus is on checking for parking stickers. Considering the high cost of living here, I believe this complex is not worth it.

Have lived in Oak Hill for two years and change, and it’s been a genuine pleasure - - and will continue to be, I’m certain! The amenities are great, the homes are spacious, and it’s a lovely neighborhood. But most of all I want to give a gigantic shout-out and blessing to the management office team, the leasing office, security, and maintenance. When you’re in need, they’re there. And a special shout-out to the assistant property manager, Dominique, who helped my partner and I when our finances were tight in order to help us afford to stay and helped us when a former roommate left and safety was a concern! I cannot express my gratitude and sheer relief at being pleasantly surprised again and again by the OH team. Y’all rock, here’s to year three!

I have lived at Oak Hill for 3 months. I have had the hot water go out no less than 5 times. This most recent time I haven’t even heard anything back from the maintenance team. The maintenance team that, mind you, doesn’t even have the keys to ACCESS my water heater. I have left voicemails, sent emails, and this issue hasn’t been taken care of. The maintenance team is by definition incompetent, as they literally do not have access to the system they’re meant to repair and the few lucky times they had access they told me they don’t know how to fix it and called an outside contractor.

The manager, Evan, will of course send you a token email and then provide no updates whatsoever on the situation. Mind you, the hot water was already out earlier this year for over a week. I have never had this issue with any other rental and have never had this poor a service experience in all my life.

This is a great neighborhood, these are beautiful apartments, but I can’t recommend you live here because management has allowed my unit to become uninhabitable over 6 times within 90 days. I attached screenshots to show the sheer number of service requests I’ve had to put in. It’s so bad I literally can’t make this up.

Don’t rent here until they can handle what everyone else I’ve ever rented from has been able to for less money.

Lived here for 2 years and as the rent has gone up the upkeep has gone down. I do not blame the maintenance people here as there are only 2 for 500+ units. Management has done nothing to deal with the problem tenants. the people living across the hall leave their trash in the hallway and take the time to yell in the halls at al hours and when brought up to management nothing gets done. do not waste your time or money on these apartments. this is section 8 housing and it shows.

Outdated Radio Format.  This classical music station is stuck in the 80s.  They still interrupt music to give frequent weather forecasts even though people rely on their iPhone.  Then there are the constant reminders about the radio app.  ALL stations have apps these days.  Also, it’s always raining in their forecast even if the chance is 5%.  They constantly over and over play an annoying “Harmania” jingle, as if anyone is going to get up Sunday morning at 6AM to listen.  WQED TV recently brought in a new CEO.  WQED FM needs to clean house too. Nielsen ratings put them at 2.7 against top performer WWSW at 10.7  Action required.

First and foremost, this is a great museum, immaculately maintained and very interesting exhibits.

First off, admissions - we received a modest discount for veterans and students, so thanks for that.  Also, a friendly welcome upon entering, the center certainly has a welcoming feeling.

My overall impression was this was a museum about Pittsburgh…so if you really wanted to learn about Pittsburgh this was fine.

I was mostly interested in the Heinz factory and history, and Mr Rogers.  I kinda felt the Center could have had more info on Heinz.  Compared to Hershey where you really get a sense of the “how” and the entire process, the Heinz center didn’t really get after that.  At a superficial level it was fine…wish they had some sampling as well.

The sports exhibits were really cool, Pittsburgh has some incredible sports history.

Overall, yes I recommend…it’s. A great museum and depending on your tastes and interests could very well be 5 star experience.

This Museum was absolutely incredible. They have way more than just the history of Heinz brand, but also has a special exhibit from the Smithsonian on women's history. There is also a kid's area called Discovery Cove which has plenty of Hands-On activities for the little ones. There is so much to see, that it may take more than one trip to get through. I would highly highly recommend coming here.

This was a pretty amazing history museum. I went specifically to see the Mister Rogers exhibit, but there was so much more that was intriguing as well. Students with IDs get discounted admission. The history of Heinz, the historical contributions of Pittsburgh women, the many ethnicities representing Pittsburgh, and general Pittsburgh items in general were all very interesting.

This was a great museum, a little bit of everything. We really enjoyed the Mister Rogers exhibit. The history of Heinz food was very interesting. There was a level devoted to sports as well. My wife was burned out on football and baseball by then. We toured the NFL HOF in Canton and did stadium tours for the Steelers and Pirates.

This was a great museum! I particularly enjoyed the Women in History exhibit and the sports exhibit on the 2nd floor. I also loved seeing little snippets of what they have in storage and the Louise Silk textile exhibit. Really well put together museum.

We came to Kaya when the snow was initially shutting the city down, we took the bus down to the Strip for a trip to somewhere warmer. Because of the weather, they were understaffed and offered a seat at the bar, which we took gratefully. The staff, under stress, was still stellar. The happy hour drinks are delicious and worth the visit. The wings are just as good as everyone says.  The fish was delicate and well balanced. I loved this meal, and I hope to come back to Kaya for a more regular, extended experience.

I walked by this place when I was visiting and the food I saw at the outdoor tables made me stop in for lunch! The atmosphere is fun and the service is great! Absolutely amazing food. The jerk wings were Incredible. Dry rub with a spicy, tangy sauce drizzled on top and they came out as hot and fresh as can be. I also got the rainbow salad, which was filled with fresh ingredients. The salmon had a light char and remained medium and flakey inside. Definitely recommend.

We were able to get a seat around 7pm without reservations, but it picked up significantly after we sat down. Service was wonderful, lots of great cocktail options, I had a very unique but delicious dark and stormy, it had apple butter in it, which was surprisingly delicious! My husband had a spicy margarita that was very spicy but well balanced with the cucumber. The conch fritters were so shockingly good! I wouldn't have expected a restaurant on the strip in pittsburgh to have such good ones. The cuban was good, not the best we've had, but still really good. It could have used more pickle and more meat. The only thing we would change is the fries, I'm not sure if it was an off night, but they were really crunchy and little flavor. Also, the tables are just really close together, so it was hard to talk and not listen to the tables next to us, I think most nights it would be fine, we just had a loud couple with interesting stories next to us. That being said, the inside is beautiful and well decorated, very fun and inviting atmosphere.

Very enjoyable first dinner in Pittsburgh. Everyone tells you to go tot he strip district for food - that’s definitely the move. We stumbled upon Kaya and despite not having a reservation, they kindly seated us quickly at the bar (which I generally prefer anyways). The night included a perfect passion fruit margarita, queso with chorizo, a Cuban, and crispy fish tacos. The crispy fish tacos were surprisingly the largest volume of tacos I’ve ever gotten and they were delicious. Everything else was scrumptious as well. Really enjoyed the experience at Kaya.

Originally, I had planned to dine somewhere else in the strip district, but given the lack of vegetarian options there we decided to come here at the last minute. It was a Monday night, and yet the restaurant was fully booked and we had to sit at the bar to order food, which tells me that they are pretty popular with the Diners. The theme is supposed to be Caribbean, but I found the menu to be overall American and Caribbean plus Mexican. We started with the queso and chips. Originally it comes with chorizo, but since I had a vegetarian Friend, we asked for the chorizo to be removed, and they were pretty gracious to do that. The dip itself was great, but the chips felt like they were bought from trader Joe’s. My friend had cocktails as well and they liked it. For our entres, I got the jerk chicken, which seems to be one of the specialities. My other friend got a jerk chicken sandwich, and another friend got the vegetarian sandwich. They liked the dishes. By half chicken came with a side of avocados and tomatoes, and other stuff, and it was pretty salady. The chicken itself was extremely well cooked and extremely choosy. However, the jerk flavour could have been a little more amplified. Overall not a bad dish. However, none of the dishes were memorable for me, and I don’t know if I’ll be back here again for dinner.

Was here for the Chris Tomlin concert.Handycap
Parking was alittle crazy to get to but that was due to road construction
The event staff was friendly & helpful.
Loved it would definately go back again.
Sturgill Simpson killed it. Every seat is a great place to watch the show. Event parking only $15 and drinks are cheaper then most concert venues

Had a really great experience here (ONCE ACTUALLY INSIDE THE VENUE). Concert was amazing, sound was fantastic. Concessions were fairly quick and reasonably priced. Staff was very helpful. Would love to see another show here. The hill you have to climb to get here... Brutal. But worth it.

Company box seats.
They were glad to accept my parking fee but provided no traffic control when leaving.
Getting out was difficult, to say the least.
Even so, I will be back if given the chance.

The parking is a mess. Be prepared to walk for blocks. The layout of the seating is complicated, and when you're having an issue finding your seat, they'll get snippy and shine their flashlight in your face. The steps for level two are steep and narrow and a fall hazard. The facilities were clean, and this was this place's only saving grace.

name: Eberly Hall
address: University Drive B, Pittsburgh, PA 15260, USA

reviews.text: Love this place, sometimes a bit pricy but they have items and a selection that I have never found elsewhere! I enjoy a lot of their foods, produce just be sure to eat it fast, or it tends to spoil fast. But, that means its fresh and fruit is sweet and properly ripe when buying, good quality. Highly recommend this store!

I shop here regularly to get my snack fix on new things. They have a fantastic variety of Asian foods as well as a Thai street food style indoor prepared food section which I adore. It's not the cleanest place but serves its purpose well for low priced goods of all sorts. The biggest con for me would be that the staff (mainly cashiers) are often less than friendly.

Consumer alert by the ACHD for: Rodent infestation observed with gnawed on foods, droppings and nestings throughout. 8-10 dead mice found throughout. Rice beetle infestation. Dead crabs found with live ones. Unsanitary conditions. Severe foul odor in the seafood cooler. Improper handwashing. No certified food manager. Walls, ceilings, floors in disrepair. The tofu kitchen area was found dark, wet, with paint chipping and covered in slime. Mops found touching food prep area. Expired products found for sale some dating back to 2018. Gross!

Dear lotus

Thanks for an excellent shopping experience. Your staff is very helpful and friendly. I love the spicy chili oil with peanuts. Amazing. See you next time.

This is a no frills east asian food store. All shelf labels are in English but the packaging is in the native language that it originated. It's a great place to get a variety. For example, if I want oyster sauce, Walmart might have one brand. Lotus Foods has 6. They have 8 variety of dried mushrooms. It's the only place I have been able to find natto beans. The prices are very reasonable. They have a website where you can look for items before you go.
Drove in from Cleveland for a Monday night game. Nice arena. Quick entrance,  nice bathrooms loads of concessions.

Was a great experience! Venue was clean, staff helped usher people to the right area, concession attendants were prompt and quick with orders. Seats in the upper division are tight, but expected in an arena. Remember the arena is always 15-20 degrees cooler, so recommend a jacket or hoodie.
Great first ever hockey game. The arena is amazing, clean, and the game was perfect. They did lose, but with 12 fights, I wasn’t disappointed.
Great experience for Australians visiting
Loved my seat! People there to help helped and were friend... hell one remembered me outside... to top it off we won!!!

Had a nice meal (sausage platter) and drinks here but 4 stars because no prices on the drink menu. $11 for a cider goblet (10oz) is high and unexpected and almost feels like a bait and switch.

Update the menu with prices and I’d be happy to update to five stars.

I enjoyed my visit to Penn Brewing sampling  locally made Pierogi and Potato Pancakes made in-house along with great beers.  The Pittsburgh Steak Egg rolls were significantly different from a Philly Cheese Steak version but enjoying them as well. I ate a lot!
Fun experience at Oktoberfest. Good beer and good music. The food was not spectacular. Overall a nice brewery with a lot of history and a nice view of Pittsburgh.

Good beer and nice facility; food is not nearly as good as it used to be. The spatzle was made with an American Cheese, like velveta?! The schnitzel were very overcooked. Waitresses worked really hard and provided good service.
Great neighborhood brewery with impressive menu and historic building.  Oldest brewery in Pittsburgh.  Get the sausage plate!

I had a backpack sprayer leak Weed B-Gon all over me....soaked the t-shirt on my back.  Checked Dr. Google, to see if it was toxic, and info ranged from "seek help immediately" to saying the "product is non-toxic".

I called and spoke with Trisha who was extremely helpful --- as I wasn't sure if this stuff could affect the neurological system or cause other issues.

We are truly Blessed to have this service and people like Trisha answering calls.

The peace of mind from being able to speak with someone so knowledgeable as Trisha, is priceless.
Called when my son ingested some sunscreen lotion. They were prompt and super helpful.
All I’m going to say is seriously did not help at all.  Deserves no stars.  I will call the hospital from now on like I did with.
Gardening mishap with nightshade, and they helped answer my questions in just a few minutes. Thank you!

name: Paul Andrew Gardner, MD
address: UPMC Presbyterian, 200 Lothrop St a402, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text:
My father had brain surgery at UPMC with Dr Paul Gardner.
Dr Gardner is a special human being, a great surgeon AND a Doctor with a heart. We are so glad that we found him and that he was the one who did the surgery.

The hospital and the staff are very special as well, each and EVERY person working there is looking how they can be of help, I would highly recommend Dr Gardner and this facility UPMC.

My wife had surgery on April 27, 2020. She had a large non-cancerous tumor removed. (Craniopharymagioma) This tumor went undetected for nearly 10 years. I will never forget our first appointment with Dr. Gardner. He told us that he would get the surgery scheduled ASAP and then stated that the tumor was in very difficult location but was confident that he could fix it.
I could write a book about my wife's experience. Its been 4-1/2 years and I strongly believe if it wasn't for Dr. Gardner and his team my wife would not be here today. She survived a 12+ hour surgery and suffered many other unrelated set backs on her journey to get home. I told Dr. Gardner I wanted to do one of those UPMC commercials. You know "My wife didn't choose to have a brain tumor but we chose UPMC". Dr. Gardner is simply a badass.

Dr. Paul Gardner was simply amazing. From the moment he first walked into the room for my first appointment I felt such a peace about him handling my care. He cared about me. He cared about my pregnancy. He cared about my health, my family and my future. He answered my questions. He listened. He made a plan in the best interest of my baby & I that put me at complete peace. He checked on me the evening of my surgery after completing several surgeries to make sure the miscommunciation with nursing staff about my pain medication was sorted out. He removed my entire "giant" tumor after another hospital said they'd probably have to leave some of it behind.  I just returned from my 3 month post-op appointment and I feel fabulous. I would recommend Dr. Gardner to ANYONE without ANY hesitation.

I honestly believe the decision to get a second opinion and switch surgeons changed the trajectory of my health for the rest of my life.

Doctor Gardner is an amazing surgeon.  He saved my sons life with his care and expertise.  This man is a world class leader in Neurosurgery and we are grateful for his skill.  Incredible person.  He is extremely busy - people need to understand that while your waiting and he's delayed to your office time, he's probably saving someone's life - be respectful.

Dr. Gardner successfully removed my dad's (age 71) brain tumor. The initial MRI report said malignant unless proven otherwise, so our family was terrified. Dr. Gardner was confident at Dad's first consultation that the tumor was in fact benign, and he was optimistic and reassuring. Happily, he was right. The nine hour surgery was successful, and though the first days following were grueling (which Dr. Gardner prepared us for), my dad has gotten stronger every day, and Dr. Gardner said he expects a normal life for him. We will be eternally grateful for Dr. Gardner, who saved my dad's life. Thank God for brilliant surgeons like him who've dedicated their lives to healing the sick. Pittsburgh is lucky to have him. Highly recommend.

name: Towers Jeffrey D
address: 200 Lothrop St Ste 3950, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

name: David O. Okonkwo, MD, PhD
address: UPMC Presbyterian, 200 Lothrop St a402, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: Amazing physician who cares about patient autonomy and supports them in any way he can. Following an accident he was communicative to my family in early recovery. More importantly he has supported me in my recovery and return to life. He is awesome and I appreciate how much he cares for patients who are unconscious.

It’s hard to find words to express my huge gratitude! The bottom line: Dr. Okonkwo GAVE ME MY LIFE BACK!!! That’s not a cliché - it’s fact. He is a brilliant and exceptional neurosurgeon, at the forefront of advancements in his field, who focused on me, his patient, and planned and performed the spinal surgery that he determined would bring me from disability to mobility. He and his team worked together on my case: the evaluations were extensive and thorough, and the compassion was heart-felt. My history and symptoms were paramount, plus test results were carefully reviewed. All of the staff is top-notch! A special shout-out to the amazing PAs: Alycia, Danielle, and Lauren. They do much of the intake and follow-up, and know exactly what to look for - most importantly, pertinent information they need to pass on to Dr. Okonkwo. Yes, when the time comes for the doctor himself to see you, he may have a packed day (emergencies, critical patients) and perhaps be running late.…so definitely be ready for it (block extra time off, and bring snacks just in case ;)). That being said, the majority of my appointments were right on time. Just remember that we are all in this together, and his office is patient-driven! When Dr. Okonkwo walks in the room, he looks you in the eye and tells you the most important things you need to know, and doesn’t gloss over your condition. He’s razor sharp, personable, compassionate, focused, and doesn’t waste time, plus he usually has a laugh to lighten things up. If you feel that you didn’t get enough information, simply ask! :) On the day of my 6-hour surgery, I felt nothing but total TRUST in Dr. O, and that’s not a sentiment that comes easily to me. The surgery was wonderfully successful (spinal fusion of L4-L5 and L5-S1 via ALIF with posterior instrumentation on 58-year-old female), and I will always be grateful each and every day, and THANK GOD, for this gifted and dedicated surgeon! Dr. David O. Okonkwo is a TREASURE!

Had spinal fusion L3 to pelvis.  Doctor Okonkwo is a careful surgeon, and a fantastic one. He is conservative yet decisive. He did a complicated fusion on my spine, and did a great job. Highly recommend.

Dr O IS HANDS DOWN THE BEST THERE IS! treats you like a human being, listens, cares and tells you the truth! Trust him completely.  He saved me from never walking again, and although I know I'll soon need another back surgery ,I will wait till he is available..

Dr. Okonkwo reconstructed my spine 3 years ago and I haven’t had any pain since that day. I’m back to doing everything I did before the surgery.
I was is a wheelchair and in extreme pain. I went to several doctors before seeing him and they would not touch me because my spine was collapsing.
He’s the best neurosurgeon in this area.

Am amazing doctor and team! My dad had a tumor in his esophagus and stomach and they were able to do the surgery laparoscopically and remove all the tumor and all the diseased tissue around it! They would call every couple hours during a 12-hour surgery to let us know an update. Additionally he himself came down to speak to us after the surgery procedure was over. Thank you doctor and to all on his team!!!

I would not have taken the time to write this review if it was not for the extremely Rude scheduler behind the cubicles in this office. First of all, I brought my mom in for her appointment at 9:00a.m. Office empty, no one at the check in window. Why would there be? They were all down the hall gabbing and chitty chatting. Must be the "opening Coffee Break". Anyways, we got through the appointment which was a tad strange for we had a 9:00am appointment and we were still waiting at 9:30 and there were no other patients in the office. Again, must have been the gathering of the minds over coffee. We came up after the appointment to the check out window and again, no one there. My mother had to call out "is anybody here"? waited so long had to take a picture of here waiting. Finally, well, maybe not, a woman popped out from behind a cubicle and came up to our area. Now, I reached into my pocket for my phone and habitually brought my "vape" out with it and all of a sudden this woman rips into me like the gestapo about my vape pen and "orders" me as if I am some kind of child to "put it away now!" Eyes pierced and seemingly ready for an argument. Young lady, I think you need to worry about your boss taking drugs more than a vape pen that pokes out of a clients pocket. Secondly, you were also a part of the chat sessions down the hall when clients were waiting at the window. A bunch of clowns! Teach your people customer service, courtesy, diplomacy, kindness and respect for their elders. Maybe you should teach then how to treat people, how to talk to them, speak to them. Its no wonder the office was empty. Your doctor already got demoted why not try helping him out with some decent respectable employees? Sounds like its time for a few seminars to me.

Dr. Luketich operated on my husband Aug.2023 and literally saved his life. I would recommend him to everyone and I have. He's professional and is a great surgeon. I have nothing but good things to say about him.

Dr. Luketich is one of the super best surgeon i ever met. He always give right and correct information about your health. He give enough time to me and explained my situation in details including draw the picture. He recommend surgery only & only if necessary. I highly recommend him and advice that before take any decision please meet at least once to Dr .Luketich.

This doctor did the right thing and sought help for a potential addiction. There is nothing wrong with taking suboxone as long as it helps you to stay sober. There are far worse things that we can do as addicts yet when we try to do the right thing, we’re still criticized and belittled. Many of us out there take it and continue to live a productive life. It is already difficult enough to maintain recovery without the belittling and backlash.  I fully support this man
Does anyone know where Dr. Bazaz has went? I don’t want anyone else but if I have too I wish I at least got a referral from him so I can at least have a good Dr.
@Judy he is in greensburg working excela hospital.

name: Kevin M. McGrath, MD
address: 200 Lothrop St Ste D380, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: Today I spoke with an individual about a very critical situation for my wife. I told Dr McGrath’s office that she here problem needs addressed right away and was told that they couldn’t do that. She was told by our PCP that she needs to see Dr McGrath ASAP but the person I talked to didn’t care. From everything I read Dr McGrath seems to be very good and it’s a shame that this person won’t do what needs to be done to get us in to see him.

Dr McGraph took a frightening experience and through close monitoring over the years has made the issue manageable.
Great bedside manner, explains everything in laymen’s terms. Highly recommend him for all gastro needs.
Dr. McGrath is kind, patient and the most competent MD is southwestern PA. We are so lucky to have him in Pittsburgh.  Don’t settle for less than this man.
Dr. McGrath is the unqualified best!

name: John J. Moossy, MD
address: UPMC Presbyterian, 200 Lothrop St a402, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: Staff is rude and he has no beside manners. Did a full lumbar fusion on me and only seen me 1 time after but he continued to mail prescription for oxycodone to my pharmacy. Other words did horrible sugary then threw pain pills at it.

Both Cindy and Kathy the secretaries have been extremely rude with me on multiple occasions.  Dr Moossy ordered a FCE that had nothing to do with my job and when I passed it lied on an office note from my next visit to make it sound like I was trying to get out of going back to work. He sent that to my insurance company so they cut off my disability pay and health insurance.  The whole time I was told this was a 2 to 2 and a half year recovery and now only a year and a half in and they expect it to be better when it’s not.  I was lied to again today because Dr Moossy had said his secretary would write me a letter to get my disability and insurance turned back on but when Kathy called to see what I needed she said no I’m not writing you anything because you just don’t want to go back to work your fce is fine.  I said I explained everything to the Dr this morning and he said you would do this for me and she said no he didn’t say that because I just talked to him and he told me absolutely do not write him a letter because he’s fine.  Now I have no disability pay and no health insurance and I’m 2 weeks from being fired from my job of 25 years because I’m still not able to go back but dr moossy told the insurance company I was based on a test that had nothing to do with my job.  If you can find a different doctor to do what you are there to see Dr Moossy for go to a different doctor because they are completely unwilling to help you out at this office and are rude and insulting while telling you they aren’t going to help you.

My experience  , stating with Dr's office staff..EXCELLENT A+++
DR Moosey...THE BEST EVER...his thoughtfulness
Extends beyond surgery.to the was he spoke to my daughter..to kindness at bed side.
All especially" Kloe " 9th floor. I felt like i was her only patient..she listened,
She assisted me( as well as) maybe( beyond)  with her time and knowledge..
Shes a real asset to your nursing staff..here at Presbyterian Hospital..Oakland Pa.
He,' Dr Moosey handles.
Pain Pump patients...and Spine Cord Stimulators as well as many other patients.
I've been searching  for help and now I found him...❤️. I thank God everyday. Now I'm driven to sing his praises  from the roof top.
Great job, Dr.Moosey..

Dr Moody has cared for me for years. He listens and takes care of me. He is aware I have rare issues and he is able to deal with them. He is A#1 in my book he has kept me going through a lot of tough health issues. He is a trustworthy Dr.

I had a Pain Pump installed by Dr. Moossy approximately three years ago and I have had nothing but problems! The first pump installed  ((Failed)) after 2 and was replaced and I felt like I was 25 years old again! Until the Anchors in my spine started brokering  off 3 times putting me into severe withdrawals! I thought I was going to die. This past February 2023 I was rushed to Presbytery Hospital when the anchors broke off again, Dr. Said he had to remove my pump. I was then told my his assistant Cathy that Dr. Moossy is done with you! Kicked to the curb! He needs the retire!

name: UPMC Digestive Health Care
address: 200 Lothrop St Third floor, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: Had my second procedure today, and this experience mirrored the first one I had a year ago:  I was treated with care and consideration at all levels, from signing in at reception until leaving the unit after completion of the procedure.  My comfort and anxiety were addressed properly, my questions were answered clearly, and various types of help were offered before I had to ask, as personnel (both those assigned to me and those not) anticipated my needs.  My physician, Dr. R, was extraordinarily good both professionally and personally.  He is responsible for using his knowledge and skill to help me survive my disease as long and as well as possible, and I am very pleased with all aspects of his care.  My confidence has been earned by him over time, and is fortified  by his support team, including personnel and clinics and labs.

I've been a patient here for over 20 years. Dr. R was my Dr for Crohns. Unfortunately he left UPMC. That was a huge loss. He was the BEST. I see Dr. S now. I'm quite satisfied with him. He's knowledgeable, professional, attentive and offers options. During procedures I was treated with dignity. The team was always professional and efficient. This center offers excellent free IBD educational events open to the public. I am very pleased with this office.
My severely handicapped son was 9 minutes late for his appointment and was turned away. Don't go to Dr pezzone. Find another doctor.

returning patient.  when I scheduled a return appointment with these folks I was treated, defined as a 'new patient.'  They couldn't or wouldn't schedule me with my original physician.  Doc showed up on a timely basis (another doc).  He promptly dumped me on a resident, I assume.  She spent half hour with me then left presumably for a consult with the doc.  Half hour later neither of them had returned.  I left without treatment.

My son had been treated here. They are impossible to reach. None of the medications worked. No new tests were requested. Communication was a nightmare because the portal did not connect to the right drs. They won't send his medical records to the new dr for 4 to 6 weeks for an unknown reason. Not helpful in any kind of way. THey are a constipated mess.

name: Robert E. Schoen, MD
address: 200 Lothrop St Ste D380, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: Dr. Schoen has done my colonoscopies and endoscopies for years and he always is so excellent. Great personality and very knowledgeable. I highly recommend him.!!

name: Robert Max Friedlander, MD
address: UPMC Presbyterian, 200 Lothrop St a402, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text:
I believe I found the most amazing doctor in Pittsburgh.  Dr. Friedlander and his team are excellent!  He truly cares to do the best and he succeeded.  He and his team at UPMC Presbyterian Shadyside performed surgery on an aneurysm in my head and was very successful!  I could not thank him enough!  I had the most caring nurses!  Thank you Katie, Brooke, Lauren and Mikayla!  Thank you to all!

Vickie Lumley
I lost all faith in UPMC when my mom passed away. Dr. Freelander has restored that faith and saved my life I'm so thankful to you and I feel great 😃

I have only immense appreciation and excellent things to say about this phenomenal Attending neurosurgeon and chair of the Neurology department at Presbyterian Hospital in Pittsburgh along with his team of learning resident Neurology doctors! Professional, detailed in finding and solving the medical situation.  He is beyond skilled, and possesses amazing medical problem solving skills. He understands all the risks and utilizes the testing available to him to work and process through your case to bring the very best possible outcome.  He is sensitive to his patients. Great at answering questions clearly. He is compassionate and caring to deliver the best possible care.  We are so thankful for his God given gifts that he is passionate about what he does and it shows.  I feel blessed at having the opportunity in such a situation as my AVM and stroke to have been under his care and discernment. I give him the highest of rating and above in my recommendation.

Dr Fried lander thank you for saving my life.  I was diagnosed with a double aneurysm.  After twelve hours of surgery I survived.   Not only i am back to
Iike.   I just had my last angiovgram it was cleanot. Both of my aneurysms are gone....Thank you for the miracle.
Saved my daughters life. Removed a Cavernous Angioma on her thalamus. I very gifted surgeon and a truly humble man. Thank you.

Dr. Sperry saved my life due to plasma being available on the Medvac. If I didn't receive the 2 units on the way to the hospital, I would be deceased.
Excellent surgeon!
Sincerely,
E. Michael J.

Ps: I would be more than happy to support any improvements Dr. Sperry feels would benefit trauma patients!
Dr Sperry saved my life! I will definitely refer friends and family to him if the need were to arise. Staff was very concerned and careful with me. Office very well maintained.

Dr Sperry's swift actions saved my sister's leg.  He was very nice and helped push her bed to the OR talking with my mom to explain what was going to happen during the emergency surgery. Thank you so much!!

Dr. Sperry saved my life after I suffered a near fatal motorcycle accident. Thankfully he was on site when I arrived by medical helicopter and immediately engaged the other top-notch surgeons to repair my broken body. A first class surgeon all the way!

Great Surgeon! I had surgery in 2019 from another surgeon at my local hospital in Greensburg Pa. She stitched me up wrong, which led to bleeding for months. From July to January 2020, when I had surgery with Dr. Speery to repair what the first doctor had did. I 10/10 recommend him, & will be back if need be.

name: Stephen O’Keefe, M.D.,
address: 200 Lothrop St # C800, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: Love community division! Adults. Those who have some experience even as younger dancer will love the intensity, live piano music and wonderful instruction !

Ballet classes are fun, accessible, great exercise, and skill building!  And did I say FUN?!  Kaitlin, Madeline, Jonathan, and others are phenomenal teachers and bring wonderful energy into their classes.

I am so grateful to Adam W. McKinney.  Something happened with my mom when we went to see the Nutcracker.  Adam handled everything right away.  He took great care of my mom.  When we went back to see Beaury and the Beast,  he actually remembered us and hugged each of us as we came into the theater.  Because of him I would go see almost anything there.  He is an amazing person.❤️❤️❤️

Drop in community classes are really great, they have options for every level dancer and the teachers are wonderful, they give lots of great feedback and adapt class for students. The company does wonderful performances as well, a great dance program for Pittsburgh to have!

We planned on going to one of their Open Air performances on Flagstaff Hill until we learned that masks are required.  We're not going to sit in the 85-degree heat with masks on, outdoors, with room to socially distance, since we've been vaccinated and the CDC finally admitted that outdoor transmission isn't a thing.  Sad that so many people are so fearful that they can't follow the science and allow a little bit of freedom when it's clearly safe to.
I was very impressed with Dr. Agarwal. He was very caring, supportive and he explained what he was doing and why. I would highly recommend him!

Dr Agarwal was very thorough kept me informed every step of my procedure. His staff very friendly
and professional

name: Marc Brian Schwartz, MD
address: 200 Lothrop St Ste D380, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text:
I am just beginning to fully grasp the extent of Dr Schwartz lack of care and empathy.

I became a patient of his when attacked by Crohn’s and was hospitalized.

He prescribed a regimen of Remecade, which initially worked.

However, the Covid shot I received made the treatment cease working.

I became deathly ill, and lost over fifty pounds. I began sending daily updates on my health status. The response I got was from a receptionist, who told me to begin taking Imodium. From there, I began calling. Dr Schwartz did not return any of my calls.

I became weaker and sicker, and did not get any response. I needed to get life flighted to a hospital, and needed surgery to remove 18” of my colon.

I was told if I had not checked myself into a hospital, I would have died.

I still never heard from Dr Schwartz, who was my primary GI.

I eventually sent an email letting him know I was releasing him as my primary GI. Again, no response.

Caveat emptor. Proceed with caution. It is your life.

Dr. Schwartz is very thorough in identifying and treating problems as they come up. My previous GI had basically left me untreated for years. After meeting with Dr Schwartz during an admission from an ER visit he had me on meds and a plan to getting healthier. Finally 2 years later I can say there is no active Crohns at the moment. Dr. Schwartz always explains treatment options and gives his opinion but lets the final decision up to me. He takes time to listen to my questions and concerns and explains the answers.  I recommend him to anyone that I can.

As a patient on and off for 4 years, he can be okay at certain times. However, actually treating and listening to how a patient feels is not how he particularly operates. I was told to wait till my office visit. For almost 2 weeks and meanwhile I lost 8 pounds in two weeks and could no longer stand up. Not so great advice. These pictures show the difference when I was diagnosed how thin I was for 7 months. And it took a year before anything was done. I move out of state due to Dr. Schwartz not trying an agressive treatment.

I can not say enough positive things about this man. For the first time since being diagnosed with my GI disease (2014) I feel like I’m actually being listened to and my disease is being treated. I have not had one issue with him or either of his offices (Presby and Shadyside). I feel as if he has utilized all that he can to make sure I’m getting the best care. I now have a therapist and a nutritionist that I never had before. He’s very honest and doesn’t sugar coat any thing and I can appreciate that . He gave me his undivided attention and plenty of time during my office visit. I’m so happy to have him as my Dr, I’m not sure where I’d be without him.

I was so excited my first appointment I really thought I found a doctor to care and knew what he was doing.  I'm a new patient who has been extremely sick, it takes days and days to try and get a hold of nurse or Dr.  When I finally get another video visit as I haven't been seen in person yet I was astounded when this doctor not only turned down a diagnosis I was previously given and try medically gaslighting me and here is the best part.  He didn't know I didn't have a galbladder....I haven't had one since 2011 and in my initial appointment I told him I've been sick since my gallbladder was removed and he still didn't know, nor did he know that I had multiple ercps with sphincterotomies again which were not only discussed prior but IN MY CHART.  The moment I realized he didn't even know me as a patient I lost all respect and faith in him as a doctor.

name: Ka-Kei Ngan, MD
address: 200 Lothrop St Ste 3950, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

name: Yuo Theodore MD
address: 200 Lothrop St # A101, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA

reviews.text: In 2018 this wonderful doctor removed a non removable IVC filter that had been “in place” inside of me for almost 10 years. It was causing damage to my IVC as well as other issues. Dr. Yuo has a great bedside manner, he really made it a point to make sure I understood the entire process. I’ve had no issues and continue to live a happy, healthy life.

A family member used this ENT. Granted it was a complex situation, collaboration and more detailed instructions for in home medications was completely lacking. The pharmacists didn’t know how to fill the medications because of lack of specificity. There was underwhelmingly limited communication with the patient. And for an ENT office, I would expect that tissues at least be in the waiting area! He is skilled with surgery but too eager to perform it on people who could try less restrictive routes.

Phenomenal doctor that truly cares about his patients. He got me my life back. I couldn't breathe through my nose for well over a year and he helped me and did surgery and now I can finally breathe again. He a remarkable doctor. He updated my husband as soon as I was done in surgery. I recommend him to so many other people.

Saved my son’s life many times. My son would not be alive. We researched and met with 35 of the top surgeons across the US and were lucky enough to have placed our son’s life in his incredibly talented hands. He IS a God amongst men. We are eternally grateful. There is no more difficult choice on earth to make and no question or doubt to Dr. Snyderman’s abilities, integrity and huge compassionate heart.

Two years ago Dr. Snyderman and Dr. Gardner removed a large chrondrasarcoma from my head . My surgery lasted 12hrs. Dr. Snyderman was so amazing. I have never had a Dr. that cared and took care of me the way he did.He and his staff are amazing and I would recommend them to anyone. UPMC is amazing

Dr. Snyderman is a hero! He saved my life. He removed cancer in my right sinus with a non invasive surgery and a month later I'm pretty much back to my normal life! He is extremely smart and one of the top doctors in the world I'd be willing to say. Thanks goes out to the whole UPMC hospital!
